titleInfo.title: Phytochemical screening and in vitro antifungal properties of Fagara zanthoxyloides

name.affiliation: Department of Science Laboratory Technology, The Federal Polytechnic, P.M.B. 55, Bida, Niger State, Nigeria.
Bacteriology Division, P.O. Box 174, National Veterinary Research Institute, Vom, Jos, Plateau State, Nigeria.

mods.abstract: Fagara zanthoxyloides was screened for biologically active ingredients and its antifungal activities. The results revealed that the plant extract possessed the following active ingredients: alkaloids, saponins, tannins and glycosides. The extract exerted inhibitory effect on Microsporum canis, Trichophyton rubrum and Trichophyton mentagrophytes. The minimum inhibitory concentration of the extract ranged between 20 and 70% (w/v), while the minimum fungicidal concentration ranged between 30 and 80% (w/v). The results obtained suggest that this medicinal plant could be useful as an anti-fungal agent.
